name: places/ChIJ3_2BR_31wokRsvEueEj4UMA
adrFormatAddress: 2276 1st Ave., New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: I first visited this garage looking for help with a dead battery in my car which was parked a few blocks away. They let me borrow their portable jump starter which was fully charged and ready to go. 20 mins later I was back with my car and they replaced the old battery for me. I can't remember the last time it was changed so it was probably time. Then I asked about a NYS Emissions inspection which was the reason I went to get my car and they advised that I needed to go for a drive first given the new battery and that after checking the ODBII found that the old battery had been dead for so long that the memory had been wiped from the cars computer. Once I returned the inspection was done very quickly. The staff were very friendly and professional. I will return if I need work doing on my car.

originalText.text: Awesome mechanics, Socrates is always very helpful.

text.text: Awesome mechanics, Socrates is always very helpful.

originalText.text:
The Indian guy working there was rude, obnoxious and condescending. They never had a $5 minimum charge for credit cards but today when I purchased a cup of coffee and a banana when I was told that there is a $5 minimum charge. When I told him that for the past few months that I had been patronizing this shell station by filling up my tank and getting coffee and fruit, there had never been a minimum. He said he started it today and it was because of me. Looked like he was a racist and had anger issues with me for no reason. Looking at some of the reviews, I think this establishment has a problem with minorities patronizing this place.

Boycott this establishment!

originalText.text: Probably the cheapest gas in the area plus I just love the quality of shell. Always great service with great prices you cant beat that. This is my gas spot.

originalText.text: Great service; gave me a quick oil change after 6pm even though they were closed. Highly recommended!
